Key Match Events: Mac Allister scored in the 48th minute
De Paul received a yellow card in the 30th minute
Lo Celso received a yellow card in the 71st minute
Nunez received a yellow card in the 39th minute
Davila received a yellow card in the 40th minute
Diaz received a yellow card in the 65th minute
Pre-Game Insights: World champions Argentina resume their quest to qualify for the 2026 World Cup when they face Chile at Estadio Mas Monumental in Buenos Aires on Thursday
Argentina sit top of the South American standings after six matches, while Chile are down in eighth place, two points behind the qualification spots
Argentina will take to the pitch in front of their own fans for the first time since retaining their Copa America title in July
Lionel Scaloni boasts a 71.4% win rate in charge of La Albiceleste
Argentina can strengthen their grip on top spot with a victory over Chile
Chile are bidding to qualify for their first World Cup since 2014
Eduardo Berizzo resigned shortly after a defeat and has since been replaced by Argentinian Ricardo Gareca
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina will be without Lionel Messi due to an ankle injury
Alexis Mac Allister was in pain after pulling up with an unspecified issue in training and is unlikely to feature against Chile
Defenders Nicolas Tagliafico and Leonardo Balerdi are both ruled out through injury
Angel Di Maria and Franco Armani have both retired from international football
41-year-old goalkeeper Claudio Bravo has retired from international football
Alexis Sanchez and Diego Valdes are both ruled out through injury
Arturo Vidal, Gary Medel and Francisco Sierralta have all been left out of Gareca's squad
